description: Coventry City report an £8.7m profit for the 2023-24 season, which includes the sales of both Viktor Gyokeres and Gustavo Hamer.
title: Coventry City: Championship club report £8.7m profit for 2023-24
title_page: Coventry City: Championship club report £8.7m profit for 2023-24 - BBC Sport
maintext:
Coventry City have reported a pre-tax profit of£8.7mfor the 2023-24 campaign - their first full season following Doug King's takeover.
The Sky Blues' financial results have outperformed most other Championship clubs.
But they also came in a season when the club sold its two star assets Viktor Gyokeres and Gustavo Hamer, following Coventry's play-off final defeat in May 2023, then fell badly out of promotion contention in 2024 after the heartbreak of another Wembley failure in the FA Cup semi-final.
Gyokeres moved to Sporting Lisbon in July 2023 for an undisclosed eight-figure fee, a record for an outgoing Sky Blues player, followed by Hamer a month later to Sheffield United, also for an undisclosed amount.
The club state that "profits on sales of players showed a significant increase to just under £24m."
